_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:38:52 using v2.7
title: How many days in total are patients delayed and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
Despite individual monthly fluctuations, the total number of days patients are delayed per month has increased over time from 109,918 in August 2010, to 154,060 in December 2015 (a 40% increase) and it reached a maximum of 164,009 delayed days in October 2015.

There is also a fairly consistent steep increase in the number of delayed days occurring from April 2014. Some of this will be because of the increases in the number of patients delayed observed in the above chart. However, it is difficult to determine whether this is the sole contributory factor or if patients are also waiting longer than before.
